definition: to close (a door)/to eclipse/muddled/stupid/ignorant/variant of 暗[an4]
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)

sentences.english: I thought to myself, 'Oh, my, he really didn't get it at all.
sentences.chinese: 我暗想，‘噢，我的天，他根本没理解这件事。

sentences.english: We wondered which group of them would eventually "move over."
sentences.chinese: 我们心中暗想，哪一片云最后会“移过来”呢？

sentences.english: Marilla shook her head. 'The child has too much imagination, 'she thought.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽拉摇摇头，“这孩子太爱幻想了，”她心里暗想。

sentences.english: You think to yourself, they have a bad attitude at work.
sentences.chinese: 你在心里暗想，他们的工作态度不好。

sentences.english: It would be different with Obi-Wan, Qui-Gon thought.
sentences.chinese: 不过他和欧比万会不一样，魁刚心里暗想。

definition: hidden smile/smirk/to rejoice covertly/secret satisfaction concerning one's evil plans
to laugh involuntarily/Taiwan pr. [e4 ran2 shi1 xiao4]
to laugh in spite of oneself/to be unable to help laughing/to break into laughter
to whine about hardships/to complain of one's bitter lot/to complain/to grumble
to force a smile/a bitter laugh
